FuncDef:
The peer-backup ttl command configures the maximum number of hops for a protection tunnel packet.
The undo peer-backup ttl command deletes the maximum number of hops configured for a protection tunnel packet.
The default maximum number of hops is 0 for a protection tunnel packet.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of hops for a protection tunnel packet.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15. The value 0 indicates that the maximum number of hops for a protection tunnel packet is not changed.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent protection tunnel traffic flapping, run the peer-backup ttl command to configure the maximum number of hops for a protection tunnel packet.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
